Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Gujarat to set up body for island develo.description: GANDHINAGAR: After a strong nudge from the PMO, the state government on Wednesday declared that it has decided to form a special Island Development Authority to develop 144 islands in and around Gujarat. The state government will soon issue a notification to set up the Gujarat Island Development Authority (GIDA) with the twin purpose of ensuring the security of islands adjoining the state and promoting tourism there. Setting up of the statutory body was announced in the 2015-16 state budget, but little headway on the proposal had been made since.  The Niti Aayog has identified 144 islands adjoining Gujarat, of which 26 are rocks in mid-sea. A majority of these islands are uninhabited and the Niti Aayog has identified seven islands that can be developed for ensuring security and promoting tourism. These include Mamalia, Murga, Bet Shankhodar, Pirotan, Savaibet, Piram and Aliyabet. The state government will develop around ten islands on a priority basis. Following the announcement of setting up of GIDA in the 2015-16 budget, the Gujarat Industrial Development Board (GIDB) has spent a sum of around Rs 10 crore to prepare a feasibility report for developing islands from the tourism and security point of view. However, little progress was made after that. “The PMO has directed to the state government to establish the Island Development Authority as soon as possible. The state government will shortly issue a notification in this regard. The CM will be the chairperson, officials of the home, tourism, ports and transport departments will be members in the body,” a senior state government official said. GIDA will be entrusted with the task of formulating and implementing various projects for development of islands and ensuring conservation of the bio-diversity of these islands. \n\u200cItalian restuarant Bella throws.description: Amdavadis can't keep themselves away from two things ­ fun and food! So when the time came for the first anniversary celebrations of Bella ­ the Italian restaurant of Crowne Plaza Ahmedabad City Centre ­ we spotted crème-de-la-crème of the city turning up and having a gala time.  The hotel has established itself as the benchmark for culinary experiences in Ahmedabad. The gastronomic selection at Bella is reminiscent of the Italian food that offers every connoisseur, a wide array of dishes to choose right from the antipasti to selection of the best homemade pasta and risotto, live pizza, a wide array of vegetarian main course dishes and more. Highlights of the new menu include delectable Truffle Scented Mushroom and Parmesan Phyllo Wrap, fresh Chicken Involtini with Gorgonzola Cheese and Tartufo with Fruit Syrup that perfectly complement the sumptuous meal. One of the remarkable features of the restaurant is the private dining space that offers you exclusivity of space and service to flawlessly host intimate gatherings.  On this occasion, Vini K. Gupta, general manager, Crowne Plaza Ahmedabad City Centre said, “Inspired by Italian trattoria cuisine, culture, and conversation, Bella was founded and has been proudly serving unforgettable meals that leave a lasting impression to our deserving guests ­ with knowledge, care and Italian charisma infused in everything we do. At Bella, we know that it is a special night out for our guests and it is our responsibility and privilege to treat it as such.“  He added, “Our menu is a mix of expertly handcrafted rustic vegetarian and nonvegetarian dishes of fresh ingredients and Italian classics. Our warm distinctive service creates a memorable, sensory experience that you'll remember long after you leave the table.“  The guests at the event were spoilt for choices and they were seen enjoying some hearty conversations.Present at this grand do were Esther David, Anil Mulchandani, Chiranjiv Patel and many more noted names. Indeed it was an evening Ahmedabad will remember for times to come where food was the star of the show! Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mating season ending, lone male great I.description: AHMEDABAD: With the mating season of great Indian bustard (GIB) set to end in July, Gujarat is sorely missing its lone male bird. Officials fear that the bird, reported missing since December 2018, has flown over neighbouring Rajasthan or, worse, crossed the border to Pakistan. Gujarat is precariously placed with regard to the critically endangered GIB. With only six birds, all females, left in the state, it is literally on verge of extinction. Deputy conservator of forest, Kutch (West), B J Asari, said the lone male bird was a sub-adult and, before it went out of sight, had started showing signs it was ready for mating. "According to an internal report submitted by search teams formed to locate the male GIB, the lone male bird was spotted in Nakhatrana from where it moved to Banni in Kutch. There is a possibility that it has moved to Rajasthan or Pakistan," said Asari. Past studies have revealed that the GIBs from Naliya in Kutch have crossed over to Pakistan. The 2017 International Union for Conservation for Nature Red List warned that "high intensity poaching still continues in Pakistan, where 49 birds were hunted of 63 that were sighted over a period of four years". With remote chances of the male GIB being found this season, the forest officials admit the state is at mercy of Rajasthan to save the GIB. "With GIB population down to a single digit in state, Gujarat will be forced to request Rajasthan to part with one male GIB to conserve the bird. We are also planning to set up our own breeding centre in Kutch for which we will need two male GIBs for captive breeding," said a senior forest official. Gujarat government has also decided to set up it's own captive breeding center in Kutch. "Gujarat is very serious about GIB conservation. The lone male bird going missing has proved to be a major setback for our conservation efforts. We have identified a site for breeding center. The department is also likely to seek assistance from Abu Dhabi for captive breeding," said a top forest official. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man got into cyber cheating to pay off l.description: AHMEDABAD: The cyber cell of city crime branch on Tuesday said that they have arrested another accused in the Rs 82 lakh cheating case, where a gang would hack the victims’ personal details, gets sim cards replaced and then siphon off their money. The accused, Sanjay Upadhyay, a resident of Jamshedpur in Jharkhand, who was arrested by cyber cell sleuths on June 14, got into the cheating business with the nine other accused to pay off a personal loan of Rs 40 lakh. “Upadhyay had met another his co-accused Matadin Sikarwar, who used to hack bank account details, when the former was in jail in connection with a cheque-bounce case. Upadhyay had been jailed for not paying instalments on his Rs 40 lakh loan in 2017. Sikarwar, along with the mastermind of the fraud, Vikas Shav, told Upadhyay that he could make quick money if he joined them in cheating people,” said a cyber cell official. The racket was busted by the cyber cell last month. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Balvantsinh Rajput and BJP resorted to c.description: AHMEDABAD: Senior Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ahmed Patel asserted that it was not him but his rival and BJP candidate in the 2017 Rajya Sabha elections, Balvantsinh Rajput, who had indulged in corrupt practices and exerted undue influence. Patel further claimed that he or his party did not lure any BJP MLA, but Rajput and the BJP had indulged in corrupt practices by threatening and luring Congress MLAs in their desperate attempt to win the election. He also said that though his party colleagues had expressed apprehensions about the BJP indulging in horse-trading to win the third seat, he realized that these were founded only after Rajput and the others quit the Congress after the announcement of the Rajya Sabha elections. In his affidavit filed in the Gujarat high court as examination-in-chief as a witness in Rajput’s petition challenging his poll victory, Patel affirms, “Balvantsinh Rajput himself contested four assembly elections as a Congress party candidate and won twice. Yet he contested the Rajya Sabha polls as a BJP candidate and sensing that victory was not possible, he resorted to corrupt practices, undue influence, threat and temptation and put in all efforts to take Congress MLAs on his side. As a result, six Congress MLAs resigned from their posts, eight MLAs did not follow the party mandate and voted against it. But 44 MLAs voted according to party’s mandate and made my victory possible.” After filing an affidavit on Tuesday, Patel is expected enter the witness box to depose and will likely be cross-examined on Thursday. Patel denied all charges of indulging in corrupt practices, exerting undue influence on MLAs as levelled against him by Rajput and some of the Congress MLAs who defected to the BJP in 2017. Ahmedabad: Perverted delivery man caught.description: AHMEDABAD: City police on Wednesday booked a 29-year-old man for molesting a 23-year-old woman at a paying guest (PG) facility in a flat in Navrangpura. The accused was identified as Bhavin Shah, a resident of Naroda and native of Dehgam. He has been a food delivery worker for about a year. His mother has been working as a domestic help in Naroda area since his father’s death. After completing Class XII, Shah started doing odd jobs, said a police official, adding that he is unmarried.  “We caught the accused from Chandkheda when he went to deliver food to someone. We had distributed his photographs to food delivery companies to trace him. The people at Uber Eats identified him as Bhavin Shah, who had worked with them. They provided his details,” said DCP Zone-1, P L Mal. Mal said that Shah confessed to the crime and said that he he had gone to the PG facility specifically to sexually abuse women. The FIR filed with Navrangpura police on Wednesday states the complainant is a native of Dungarpur in Rajasthan and worked at the PG facility as a domestic help. She was sleeping after taking some pills for her cold and cough on June 14, when the accused silently entered the room and molested her. CCTV footage shows Shah, in a yellow T-shirt and jeans, enter the flat at around 12.50am on June 14. He looks around to make sure no one is watching him and starts molesting the woman. He then he unzips his pants and masturbates beside the sleeping woman. He then entered another room to find other targets but one woman saw him. He then rushed out and escaped. Marked the women during pizza deliveryShah had first seen the women when he went to deliver pizza at the PG facility around two months ago. During his primary questioning, Shah said that he had gone during midnight to deliver pizza to some girls in the PG and decided that he would once again go there to sexually abuse the girls whom he found very fashionable from their western clothes, said a cop. Cops tracked him through food delivery appAfter police learned that the accused was a food delivery man, they started tracking his cellphone. Besides, they also took help of the food delivery firm’s app and found him at Chandkheda. He was nabbed by the cops before he could deliver food. A cop said that Shah covered his face with a handkerchief to conceal his identity and continued to deliver food to customers. But he was not aware that he could be nabbed by his cellphone location. Claims this was his first offencePolice have also begun interrogating if he had molested other women too or whether the incident at the Navrangpura PG facility was his first crime. During primary questioning, he said that he had targeted the complainant as she was sleeping. When cops asked him whether he had abused other women in the past, he remained silent for some time then denied committing any other offences. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation mulls 40.description: AHMEDABAD: If your house or residential colony was in a gram panchayat about two decades ago and now is within municipal limits, the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) will deduct 40% of your total plot area for civic services if you plan redevelopment. On May 30, the committee on Town Planning (TP) of the AMC had placed a proposal for the inclusion of the 40% deduction rule for properties of TP number 74 Chandkheda-Zundal. The amendment will have to be passed by the standing committee and the general board of the AMC. The total area of the TP scheme is 2.38 lakh square metres. “If the AMC makes the amendment for the Chandkheda-Zundal TP scheme, it will become a precedent for the rest of the draft TP schemes located on the periphery of the city which were earlier in gram panchayats,” said a senior AMC official. The same rule will apply to new areas that may be incorporated within AMC limits, including Bopal, over the next few months. “When the area fell under the gram panchayat, the deduction for civic services was just 20% because of which projects such as road expansion became challenging,” said an official of the AMC’s town planning department. “The new rule will at least allow us to demand more space.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Gujarat police make arrests in murder of.description: AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat police on Thursday arrested eight persons allegedly involved in the murder of a Dalit deputy sarpanch in Saurashtra region's Botad district by upper caste men, days after he sought police protection fearing attacks. The security provided to Manji Solanki of Jalila village in Botad district's Ranpur taluka (tehsil), who had been attacked thrice earlier, had been withdrawn while he had requested for police protection again, which was not given. His family refused to accept his body after post-mortem at the Ahmedabad Civil Hospital and demanded they be given security cover. Manjibhai's son Tushar Solanki told reporters here: "We won't take the body till we are given protection. We also want that action should be taken against police personnel who did not provide us security though we had asked for it". Botad Superintendent of Police Harshad Mehta confirmed to reporters that his office did receive an application from Manjibhai for security on June 6 and the police were examining the threat perception to him. He had been given police protection on March 3, 2018, after the last attack on him, but this was subsequently withdrawn. Solanki was allegedly attacked with clubs and iron pipes by the inmates of a car who first knocked him down when he was returning home on a motorcycle on Wednesday. The police said Solanki died on way when he was being taken to Ahmedabad Civil Hospital. He also agreed that Manji was attacked on four occasions and that the accused persons in all the attacks, including the one on Wednesday, were the same. Tushar Solanki said the upper caste members were angry with his father since he used to fight cases of caste atrocities against the Dalit community. "This is why my father had also applied for a weapon licence, besides asking for security," he said. Meanwhile, Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, who did not react to this incident, said at a meeting of the monitoring committee on atrocities against Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes that the police should initiate stern action in atrocity cases. He instructed district collectors concerned to ensure an atmosphere of amity and harmony in 32 villages and 20 mohallas where the Dalits lived under police protection. Independent Dalit MLA from Vadgam Jignesh Mevani, who was not called for this meeting, dashed off a letter to Rupani expressing concern over the situation of Dalits in the State. Mevani said the police galvanized into action only after an incident took place, but could not prevent it. Congress MLAs Naushad Solanki, Shailesh Parmar and Vasrambhai Patel called on the family of Solanki at the Ahmedabad Civil Hospital and expressed solidarity with them. Later, BJP legislator Pradip Parmar and former MLA R.M. Patel also met them. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gujarat HC: Pipavav tracks need to be mo.description: AHMEDABAD: The amicus curiae in the Gujarat high court has submitted his report on ensuring the safety of Gir lions and insisted that the railway tracks leading to Pipavav port should be shifted out of the protected area and re-laid beyond the 10-km zone. Advocate Hemang Shah, who was tasked by the HC to prepare the report and make recommendations for the safety of Asiatic lions, cited nine different things that endanger the big cats. He has not only suggested shifting of the railway tracks, but also stopping trains from plying at night. He highlighted how the chain-link fencing hampers the movement of lions. He also said that the proposal for elevated tracks would not be feasible because so much construction would be detrimental to the wildlife. Hence, the only option available is to shift the tracks and stop trains from plying at night, when lions are out hunting. He mentioned that most of the 20 trains that pass every day, do so after sunset. He stated that these are goods train and commercial interests need to be sacrificed to save lions. The amicus curiae suggested radio collaring all lions and tracking them by GPS to be able to notice their movements near railway tracks. Shah suggested strict action against those who do not cover open wells. “Protection of lions and other animals in the area should prevail over the interests of such well owners,” he said. He has also suggested stringent action against farmers who protect their fields by setting up electric fences. He suggested quick trials against such offenders to prevent the electrocution of lions. The amicus has suggested infusing animals to the Gir forest as the food chain in the area is depleted. He has suggested that roads be properly lit at night for traffic. Trackers should be provided walkie-talkies and there should be more guards. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vayu threat passed, AFES team still in P.description: AHMEDABAD: Teams of the Ahmedabad Fire and Emergency Services are the last to leave Porbandar, despite the threat from Cyclone Vayu having passed. AFES personnel, who had left for Porbandar on June 12, were instrumental in rescue operations and clearing roads. An AFES staff member said that the after the government announced that the Vayu was not going to hit the Gujarat coast, the AFES team should have been sent back along with other teams. The officer said that the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams had left the next day and teams from Vadodara and Rajkot were also told to leave the area. However, AFES teams were made to stay back in the town till Tuesday evening. Another officer said that the nodal officers, on being asked about the delay, said that the district authorities had failed to give a satisfactory reply. Officials said one officer from the district administration threatened to book them if they pressed officials to be allowed to leave. A senior AMC officer said the entire delay was totally unwarranted and the corporation may refuse to depute its staff in such emergencies in the future. The AFES is short of staff and unnecessarily forcing teams to stay back was totally unwarranted. Chief fire officer M F Dastoor said, “The Vayu threat was over last week, but the AFES team is still in Porbandar for reasons best known to the administration. We have been contacting our men only to be told that their orders to leave Porbandar are yet to be issued.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SC to hear Congress plea on Rajya Sabha.description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday issued notice to the Election Commission of India, over a petition filed by the Congress, challenging its decision to hold separate bypolls for two Rajya Sabha seats in Gujarat. A bench of Justices Deepak Gupta and Suya Kant asked the commission to file a response as to why simultaneous polls for the two Rajya Sabha seats could not be conducted as pleaded by the petitioner. The two seats fell vacant after the election of BJP chief Amit Shah and Smriti Irani to the Lok Sabha. The petition, filed by the leader of opposition in the Gujarat Assembly, Paresh Dhanani, sought the quashing of the EC’s June 15 notification treating the two seats as stray vacancies to warrant separate elections. He said holding of separate elections for the two seats would deny Congress one of the seats which it is entitled to according to its strength in the assembly and by the law mandating proportional representation with single transferable vote for the Rajya Sabha. Senior advocate Vivek Tankha, appearing for the petitioner, said there is no SC verdict on the issue but the Delhi high court had passed an order in a similar case. The court, after a brief hearing, said the issue had to be examined and adjudicated and posted it for June 25. The court said it has to be decided whether the two vacancies in the Rajya Sabha are casual or statutory. At present, in the 182-member Gujarat assembly, the BJP has 100 MLAs while the Congress has 71. If separate polls are held for the two seats, the BJP will win both. The petition filed through advocate Varun K Chopra argued that according to the Representation of the People Act, representatives of each state to the Rajya Sabha shall be elected by the members of assembly by the system of proportional representation by means of a single transferable vote. “The conduct of elections for each vacancy separately would only lead to one result, that is, the victory of the party which commands a simple majority. This would turn the very objective of proportional representation on its head,” Dhanani said in his petition. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gujarat high court orders check-up for p.description: AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Wednesday ordered the state government to place before it details of the Centre’s funding for the state’s healthcare sector and the state’s budgetary allocations for it. The bench headed by acting Chief Justice A S Dave sought a reply from the government on the breakup of budgetary allocations for the healthcare sector. The court was hearing a PIL filed earlier this year by retired joint director of health services, Dr Madhavji Gajera, complaining about the poor healthcare infrastructure and the shortage of doctors and medical staff in government health centres and hospitals across rural areas, said the petitioner’s advocate, K R Koshti.  The petitioner cited reports of the central government to emphasize the fact that average spending on health amounts to 58% of the average family income in Gujarat. The high court has asked the petitioner to come up with details on budgetary allocations for the healthcare sector in other states. Further hearing has been posted for July 1. The PIL contended, “The healthcare infrastructure of this state is crippling as a result of which the health of the ordinary citizen is in serious jeopardy.” Gajera has sought the court’s directions to the government to provide all healthcare facilities at primary health centres, sub-centres, community health centres as well as district hospitals in tribal and non-tribal rural areas. The petitioner has demanded that health facilities adhere to the Indian Public Health Standards in terms of infrastructure, manpower, availability of necessary drugs and equipment, and services such as ambulance, water supply, electricity, and bio-waste management. The PIL demanded the formation of a special committee of health experts to recommend measures to deal with the deficiencies in the healthcare system. The petitioner cited the 2017 Rural Health Statistics Report to highlight the dearth of doctors, particularly specialists, in health centres and hospitals in rural areas. These vacancies aggravate the situation during outbreaks of diseases such as malaria, dengue, chikungunya, swine flu, and zika. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nMahima Chaudhary inaugurates exclusive.description: It was an evening of the unconventional complementing the natural, when Stonex India Pvt Ltd inaugurated its exclusive Experience Gallery in Ahmedabad. Natural stones, textures and experiential design became the topic of discussion on the inauguration night, which had actress Mahima Chaudhary as the guest of honour.  It is the first company in the country which spearheaded the concept of experience galleries for clients with a penchant for exclusivity. Vikas Agarwal, director, Stonex India Pvt Ltd, said, “We have always tried to comprehend our customer’s needs and aspirations, and broadly succeeded in the initiative.” Saurav Agarwal, director, Stonex India Pvt Ltd, said, “We have always offered our patrons the best quality product.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gujarat: Board students can now choose c.description: AHMEDABAD: The students of class X and XII can now select their exam centre at their native place. The decision was taken on Thursday during the general meeting of the Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSHSEB). Apart from this, if a student feels that a certain exam centre has a bad reputation due to cases of mass copying or irregularities reported in the past, the student can seek another exam centre. This will particularly benefit students who stay in hostels or away from their hometown. The state education board took another important decision regarding attendance shortfall of students. Earlier, students who had short-attendance were often barred from appearing for the board exams. However, a student who faces short-attendance can now appear as a private student or in individual capacity for the board exams. GSHSEB members also took up the issue of several schools operating on paper and decided that strict action would be taken against these schools and their registration/ affiliation may be cancelled too. The board also decided to identify and take strict action against schools that give admissions to their students in Class XI before the results of class X are announced. ACB unearths plots worth Rs 2.5 crore be.description: AHMEDABAD: Officials of the Gujarat anti-corruption bureau (ACB) on Tuesday said that the former MD of the Gujarat Land Development Corporation (GLDC), K S Detroja, had bought more than 70 hectares of land, worth about Rs 2.5 crore, in six districts of state.  During their six-month investigation, ACB officials found that Detroja had bought the land in a period of two years, when he was MD of GLDC. ACB officials also informed income tax officials, to initiate proceedings against Detroja for his unaccounted income. Officials say Detroja had amassed properties worth more than Rs 100 crore. The GLDC scam came to light after it emerged that false bills worth hundreds of crores were generated and the money was siphoned off during the state government’s campaign to deepen ponds and lakes ahead of the monsoon last year. The government in November 2018 decided to close down the public sector unit after failing to control the rampant corruption in it. The comptroller and auditor general of India (CAG) also reported massive irregularities in GLDC. In April 2018, the state ACB raided the GLDC headquarters in Gandhinagar and seized Rs 56.50 lakh in unaccounted cash. After the raid, five GLDC officials, including Detroja and joint director K C Parmar, were arrested for taking bribes from farmers who had applied for government grants under schemes executed by the corporation. A case under the Prevention Of Corruption Act, 1988, was lodged against Detroja and others. The probe revealed that Detroja and his aides allegedly took commissions from farmers to clear grants allocated by the state government for farm ponds and soil tests. Encounter investigator is now IIM-Ahmeda.description: AHMEDABAD: Rajnish Rai, 1992-batch IPS officer of Gujarat cadre, turned over a new leaf and began working as assistant professor at IIM-Ahmedabad (IIM-A) last month. Prof Errol D'Souza, director of IIM-A, could not be contacted for his comment on Rai’s appointment. The IIM Ahmedabad website has already put up a faculty page for Rai, which shows him as part of the public management think tank, Public Systems Group (PSG), and also mentions his official email id. Rai, who had probed the 2005 Sohrabuddin Shaikh fake encounter case and had arrested fellow IPS officers D G Vanzara, Rajkumar Pandian and Dinesh M N in 2007, was suspended from service in December 2018. Before his suspension, he had appealed for voluntary retirement upon reaching the age of 50 years, under the provisions of All India Services (Death-Cum-Retirement Benefit) Rules, 1958. But the Union government had rejected his application for retirement. Rai went to the CAT and then Gujarat high court over the issue, but the Union government, meanwhile, issued a chargesheet against him for handing over charge without due authorization and abdication of office, and then suspended him. Sources said that Rai’s appointment at IIM-A took place in May during a faculty recruitment seminar. “Rai was found to have academic qualification and experience required for the job,” said an official close to development, claiming that Rai’s ongoing legal battle has little bearing on the appointment. The appointment fulfils the IPS officer’s long pending ambition for a second career innings in academics. Earlier in 2014, Rai had requested the government to relieve him so that he could join the IIM Udaipur as a professor in business policy and strategy. His request was turned down. Rai, 53, was posted outside Gujarat ever since 2014, and his last posting was IGP and principal of Counter Insurgency and Anti-Terrorism (CIAT) School of Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) in Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh. He had hit the headlines in 2014, when as chief vigilance officer at Uranium Corporation of India at Jadugoda in Jharkhand he had found irregularities and had submitted the findings to CBI. He was charge-sheeted for the unauthorized probe, but received reprieve from CAT’s Hyderabad branch in 2017. Rai’s academic profile cites his educational qualification as BTech, PGPPM, PG in Patents Law and PhD. Rai, who was at loggerheads with the state government, spent the better part of the last decade pursuing his academic interests. He was also named in a copy case in his LLB examination from which he was cleared by the Gujarat high court due to lack of evidence in 2008. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Man abroad gives triple talaq to wife ov.description: SURAT: A 26-year-old woman living in Sanjan, Valsad district has lodged a complaint against her husband and in-laws after he gave her triple talaq over an instant messaging application. Based on her complaint, Umargam police booked Jailun Kaliya and his parents Javed and Nafisa. Kaliya is abroad and he sent the talaq nama (divorce deed) on WhatsApp to his mother last month. She took a printout and submitted the papers at a local mosque. The complainant, Farhim said the mosque administrator informed her father Salim of the divorce deed, but she and her family refused to accept it. On June 14, she approached Umargam police. Farhim alleges her husband, Jailun, decided to divorce her as she turned down his request to give their son to his sister did not have kids. "The accused husband is out of country and his location is not known. He works in shipping industry and is likely to return in a few months. He sent the talaq nama on WhatsApp to his mother," said police. While Farhim told police that Kaliya was in Canada, his parents claim he is in Dubai. The accused were booked under various sections of the IPC and The Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Ordinance, 2019. Police have registered the statements Kaliya and his parents as well as other witnesses in the case. "Further action will be taken after recording the statement of the mosque administrator," said police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Serial blasts: Gujarat HC stays contempt.description: AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court has stayed the special court hearing the 2008 serial blasts case from initiating contempt of court proceedings against Madhya Pradesh officials for not shifting 10 serial blasts accused from an MP jail to Sabarmati Central Jail. The high court also said that the accused would remain at the Bhopal Central Jail and will face the trial through video conferencing. The HC issued notices to the government of Gujarat and the 10 accused, who want to return to Sabarmati Jail, and posted a further hearing for July 9. On June 1, the special judge ordered the Bhopal central jail superintendent and IG (Prisons) in MP to shift 10 accused, including Safdar Nagori, to Ahmedabad on their request to face the rest of the trial here. They were shifted to MP jail after their conviction in a terrorism case more than a year ago. In its order, the trial court issued production warrants under Section 267 of the CrPC to lodge 10 accused in Sabarmati jail by June 20. This needed to be done by revoking Section 268 of the CrPC, imposed by the MP government, to lift restrictions on their movement. The trial court also ordered that these accused would remain at Sabarmati jail in its custody till their further statements are recorded. The trial court warned of initiating contempt proceedings against officials, if they failed to follow the order. The MP government challenged the trial court’s order before the HC, insisting that the trial court cannot issue production warrants before Section 268 of CrPc is revoked, and cannot initiate contempt of court proceedings. Justice S H Vora agreed with the MP government’s submissions and said, “Needless to say that once the power under Section 268 of the code is invoked, provision of Section 267 of the code loses its effect. Still however, the learned trial judge issued production warrant under Section 267 of the Code before the notification issued under Section 268 of the code stands revoked.” The HC also termed the trial court’s order as “general and vague” on the issue of contempt proceedings and said that the powers are vested with the high court. Man thrashed for refusing to clean gutte.description: VADODARA: A casual labourer was beaten up for allegedly refusing to manually clean a gutter line near Karachiya railway crossing of Bajwa on Wednesday. The accused Mahesh (Vasava) Darbar was arrested by Jawaharnagar police on Thursday for assault and criminal intimidation. The complainant Balwant Harijan was approached by Darbar when he was waiting at a paan shop in Bajwa Wednesday morning to clean the a clogged gutter line at his home. After checking the condition of gutter line, Harijan told Darbar that he will charge Rs 200 for cleaning it which Darbar refused and instead offered him Rs 50. Harijan turned down the offer and walked away. In the afternoon, when Harijan was returning home after eating lunch at an eatery near Karachiya railway crossing, Darbar confronted him. Harijan again said that he will clean the gutter only if he is paid Rs 200 or else he was not interested. Police said that Darbar was enraged by Harijan’s refusal so he started hurling abuses at him and hit him with a shovel. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Police catch drunk man, let woman go.description: AHMEDABAD: Vastrapur police had an embarrassing moment on Sindhu Bhavan Road late on Monday night, when a woman of about 30 gave them the slip and zoomed off in her car while the cops were busy checking her allegedly drunk co-passenger. An FIR registered at Vastrapur police station by an assistant sub-inspector, Kirtan Parsingh, states that he and a constable, Baldev Lakshman, was on vehicle-checking duty on Monday night at the Sindhu Bhavan check point. At around 4.20am, they stopped a car carrying a woman and a man. The woman was driving, while the man was sitting beside her, the FIR states. The cops claimed that the man was drunk and that they could feel smell liquor on his breath. When they asked him to get out of the car and he complied, the woman zoomed away. The cops, satisfied with nabbing the drunk man, ultimately booked him in a prohibition case. The man booked is around 30 years old and is a resident of Ambawadi. Last year, police had let off a young woman, the granddaughter of a prominent politician, when she was caught drunk. Vastrapur police inspector M M Jadeja was not unavailable for comment. Flight from Ahmedabad to Mumbai delayed.description: AHMEDABAD: Passengers flying to Mumbai from Ahmedabad on Vistara flight UK-926 on Tuesday night had a harrowing experience, with the flight delayed by more than three hours. The flight was scheduled to depart Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International (SVPI) airport in Ahmedabad at 9.30pm. Heavy rain in the city prevented the aircraft meant to operate the flight from landing, thus delaying the departure. Passengers had not been informed of the delay in advance and thus ended up waiting four hours at the airport. “When I got a cab to the airport, it was raining heavily and it was a mad rush getting there through heavy traffic and waterlogged roads. When I got there, I learned that the flight was delayed,” said Rohit Panchal, a passenger on the flight. “Till 10.30pm I waited as the aircraft had not arrived. After that, the airline informed passengers that the incoming flight has been delayed due to bad weather. I got home after 3am,” Panchal added. An airline spokesperson said, “UK-929 operating Mumbai-Ahmedabad on June 18, 2019, had to be diverted back to Mumbai due to bad weather in Ahmedabad. The same aircraft was scheduled to operate UK-926 Ahmedabad-Mumbai at 9.30pm, which consequentially was delayed. Customers were kept informed and were provided all assistance. Delays caused due to weather conditions are beyond our control.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Monsoon likely to hit Gujarat on Monday.description: AHMEDABAD: The much-anticipated monsoon will arrive in the state by the start of next week, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast has stated. While parts of the state have been getting rain due to the impact of Cyclone Vayu, the southwest monsoon will officially arrive nine days later than normal. Jayanta Sarkar, regional director of the IMD, said the monsoon is progressing well and will likely to arrive in the southern parts of the state by June 24. “We have also issued warnings for heavy rainfall at isolated places in the districts of south Gujarat including Valsad, Navsari, Dang and Gir Somnath in Saurashtra,” he said. IMD officials said that Cyclone Vayu, which had a close encounter with the state, has certainly affected the monsoon. “It has delayed the monsoon arrival in the northern parts of the country. However, on the positive side, it has given pre-monsoon showers to most of Gujarat, which does not normally get much rainfall in June,” said an official. According to the GSDMA website, the state has so far received 44mm of rainfall or about 5% of its seasonal rain. The IMD has forecast light to moderate rains in most parts of the state for the next three days. Parts of the state saw cloudy skies for the past few days and temperatures have dropped across Gujarat, with Surendranagar recording the highest temperature of 38.7°C. Asanas helped him quit alcohol.description: AHMEDABAD: Personal tragedies pushed him to the path of self-destruction as Puvanenthiira Malai, then in his late twenties, found solace in drugs, alcohol and smoking. The phase lasted for good seven years, but yoga came as a saviour for him. “It was like another birth for me – I not only shunned all the addictions but decided to set an example. In close to 20 years, I have not taken a medicine. I’m happy that I am sharing this joy with countless others,” says Malai, now in his fifties and a master yoga trainer based in Ahmedabad. Malai, a native of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, was a sales marketing manager. “While we learn yoga right from the school, I never gave it much thought. When I was undergoing depression and refusing to take any medicine prescribed by my psychiatrist, it was my wife who prodded me to take up yoga. It did what the medicines couldn’t,” he says. He follows schools of Swami Vishnudevananda, BKS Iyengar and K Pattabhi Jois to interpret yogic practices and prepare the next crop of yoga teachers spread across Ahmedabad and other parts of Gujarat. “We train over 80 yoga trainers annually whereas number of practitioners might be in hundreds. While there were yoga practitioners even before International Yoga Day, the initiative has improved awareness among masses which is an encouraging sign,” says Malai. “People generally embrace yoga when they are at the end of their health problems. One has to have some patience for yoga to show results. The first phase can be a bit painful for some. We give them practice as per their specific issues and they slowly come out. If someone is at the end of their physical problem, yoga cannot cure it overnight,” he adds. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Ahd: Father rapes nine-year-old girl, he.description: AHMEDABAD: A horrific case emerged from the Ramol area of the city on Wednesday noon, where a man raped his 9-year-old daughter and subjected her to unnatural sex. The girl, a Class IV student, told her maternal grandmother about the ordeal her father put her through. DCP Zone 5 Akshayraj Makwana said that based on the complaint of rape and violation of the POCSO Act, they have arrested the accused, a daily wage labourer. “We sent the girl for a medical check-up, where doctors told us that they had found rashes around the victims’s private parts,” Makwana said. “According to the complaint, the accused and his wife have three children, two boys and one girl. The couple had a quarrel on Wednesday morning, after which the mother left the house for her parental home. She had left all three children behind with the father. At noon, when the boys were out playing with their friends, the accused disrobed his daughter and tried to rape her. He also used oil in his attempt penetrate the girl. He later forced her to perform oral sex on him. He then threatened the girl with dire consequences if she revealed any of this to anyone,” added Makwana. In the evening, when the victim’s maternal grandmother came to the house to work out an understanding between the couple, a shock was waiting for her. On seeing her grandmother, the girl broke down. “She told her grandmother and mother about what her father had done. The two then approached Ramol police on Wednesday night and lodged a complaint against the accused. Our team rushed to the house and arrested him. We also made him undergo a medical tests,” added Makwana. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. \u2018Bring back my wife, she is being t.description: AHMEDABAD: Husband of a 34-year old woman from the Sarkhej area of the city has filed an application of complaint with the city police that his wife Madina Shaikh has landed in trouble in Oman where she had gone to work as a domestic help. According to the complainant, Asif Shaikh, his wife somehow managed to call him from Oman and told him that she and 12-13 other women from different parts of India, have been kept locked in a room and are being ill-treated. They are even beaten there, the complainant was allegedly told by his wife.  In his complaint submitted to the city police commissioner’s office on Wednesday, Asif has mentioned that a Mumbai-based agent Naeem Shaikh and a woman from the Behrampura area of Ahmedabad Choti Khala promised them 100 dinar a month for the job in Oman. They agreed to the proposal and Madina reached Mumbai and from there she landed in Oman. Shaikh, who runs a small business, told TOI that the trouble started a week after Madina reached Oman. “My wife told me over the phone that a car comes every morning to the flat where they are locked in and takes them to some undisclosed location,” Shaikh said. Asif alleged that they are made to work the whole day and are not fed properly. “Ever since our marriage five years ago, we have been trying for a child. The good news came only when she landed in Oman. Unfortunately, our joy was short-lived as she suffered miscarriage because of the hard work she was made to do,” said Asif. Asif in his complaint has alleged that when he contacted the Mumbai agent and Choti Khala, they allegedly told him that it is not possible now to bring his wife back from that country. “Naeem told me that she can come back only if I deposited Rs 50,000 with him. I am still waiting for her to return even after giving the money. I pray to the authorities to bring my wife back and also those who are confined in Oman,” said Asif. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Ahmedabad: Ranip flyover goof-up.description: AHMEDABAD: After beginning the construction of Ranip overbridge at a project cost of Rs 78 crores, the AMC had come to realize that one end of the bridge will land on private land. The owner of the land was also not informed of the bridge alignment. AMC engineers then discovered that just beside the private plot there was a large plot belonging to Western Railway.  All these had happened despite a private consultant preparing a comprehensive project report and an agency doing third party project inspection. In the end, it was not the private consultants but AMC’s own estate department which discovered the massive blunder. The flyover connecting Ranip with New Ranip area at the GST Railway crossing over Ahmedabad-Viramgam -Rajkot railway track had been given clearance by the AMC in March 2013. However, the project was held up in red tape with the railway authorities finally approving the swapping of land on February 2, 2017 to enable construction of the flyover to take place. Standing committee chairman Amul Bhatt, who formally approved the transfer of land to the railways on Thursday said, “The project was given final approval by the former standing committee members and hence we could not do much, but have asked the administrative wing to be more cautious in the future.” Officials said the railways was not willing to sell its land to AMC and later in lieu of these 5,000 square yards of land, AMC gave nearly 11,000 square yards of land near Ranip Garden to the railways,. E-cigarettes to be banned, says Jadeja.description: GANDHINAGAR: The state government will shortly ban e-cigarettes as their use have harmful effects on the health of people, said minister of state for home, Pradipsinh Jadeja, on Wednesday. Online purchase of electronic nicotine delivery systems (ENDS) will also be banned in the state, Jadeja said in Gandhinagar. Jadeja said, “E-cigarettes purchased online will also be banned in Gujarat. The existing law will be amended in this regard. Currently, e-cigarettes have been banned in 36 countries of the world including 12 states of India.” The minister added that the state will also clamp down on the use of narcotic drugs. Sniffer dogs capable of detecting drugs will be inducted into the police force soon, he stated. Jadeja said that strict action will be initiated against officers responsible for areas from where drug seizures are made. At the same time, officers who do exemplary work in checking the drug menace will be rewarded. The minister said that in 2019 (as of May 31), 61 cases have been registered under sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act and 91 persons have been arrested so far. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Gujarat DGP warns of tough action agains.description: AHMEDABAD: Gujarat DGP Shivanand Jha on Tuesday warned police officials of stringent action if lapses were found on their part when dealing with drug peddlers and traffickers. A meeting was held with Special Group Operation (SOG) teams of different districts and ATS at DGP office in Gandhinagar. According to top police sources, the main agenda of the meeting was drug tracking and its negative effect on the youths' health. DGP Jha said they have to keep a strong vigil on the storing places and places where such drugs are sold and smuggled into Gujarat. "Top officials of CID crime were also present in the meeting. Instructions were passed on to track and nab drug traffickers along with those who deal in synthetic drugs," a top police official said. "Once these places are identified, patrolling in the area should be intensified and a close watch both technical and human should be kept nabbing drug peddlers and mafias, " he added. DGP Jha during the meeting asked top police officials of SOG to keep a watch near schools and colleges where these drug peddlers make the most. Top police sources said he also warned SOG and local police that if drugs were to be found from their area without their knowledge and by a different agency, they would be held responsible for the same.
