Father rapes nine-year-old daughter in A.description: AHMEDABAD: A man has been arrested for allegedly raping his nine-year-old daughter by Ramol police on Wednesday late night. According to police, the parents of the girl got separated some years ago. The father on the pretext of keeping his daughter took her to his house and raped her. Police said the father also forced the girl to have unnatural sex with him. The girl later told the incident to her mother, who then lodged a police complaint against her husband. The accused has been arrested under sections of rape and POCSO. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Ahmedabad: Cops get two-day custody of m.description: AHMEDABAD: A metropolitan court on Thursday sent Bhavin Shah (28), the food delivery worker who was arrested for molesting a girl at a paying-guest (PG) accommodation in Navarangpura, to police custody for two days, to find out his past behaviour and for verification by the forensic science laboratory. Navrangpura police sought five-day custodial interrogation of Shah to probe his past behaviour with women and for verification by the FSL. It was argued that if Shah was not sent to remand, the investigation would be hampered and the accused would get the benefit of inadequate investigations during the trial. Shah was arrested on Wednesday on the basis of CCTV footage from a PG facility for women in Navrangpura. He was seen molesting a sleeping girl and has been charged under Section 354 of the IPC. The police sought remand to know whether Shah, who worked as a food delivery worker for the last year, was in contact with other women through social media. It was required to find out whether he spoke indecently manner with any of these women in the past. Police also wanted to know which other women’s accommodations Shah had delivered food to. The police has sought for this information from the food delivery company. His presence would be required for verification of the facts. The court accepted these submissions and said that this was a serious issue and the alleged act is anti-social. It said Shah should be sent to two-day remand because the probe would remain incomplete without his presence in police custody. Meanwhile, cops investigating the case said Shah thought the girl he victimized was a soft target. DCP P L Mal said Shah had noticed the girl sleeping on a sofa in the drawing room while the others were sleeping in the other rooms. This made him think she was a soft target,” said Mal. Police sources said Shah zeroed in on the girl at the PG facility when he went to deliver pizza to the girls around midnight around two months ago. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day to be celebrated at heritage mo.description: GANDHINAGAR: The International Day of Yoga celebrations on June 21 will be held at all heritage locations in Ahmedabad and Gujarat, and at all important historical and religious places, the state government announced on Wednesday. A special celebration will also take place at the Statue of Unity. The theme this year is “Yoga For Heart Care.” State education minister Bhupendrasinh Chudasama said a record 1.56 crore people from Gujarat are expected to participate in the International Yoga Day celebrations in Gujarat this year. “Celebrations will be organised at religious places like Ambaji, Somnath, Dwarka etc., and at major historic monuments like Sarkhej Roja, Lothal, Ran ki Vav etc., For the first time more than 1,000 holy men will do yoga at the Statue of Unity (SOU). We appeal citizens to take part wherever they are convenient,” Chudasama said. About 12,000 students from various schools of Ahmedabad will participate in the Yoga Day celebrations at the Sardar Pattel Stadium in Navrangpura, officials of the district education department said. Mock round: 36,342 engineering seats vac.description: AHMEDABAD: The mock rounds for admissions to degree engineering colleges conducted by Admission Committee for Professional Courses (ACPC) showed that half of the seats in the state had no takers. A total of 28,799 students were allocated admission seats in the mock round. Results were declared on June 19. As many as 36,342 seats across various engineering colleges in the state were vacant at the stage of mock rounds conducted recently, said an ACPC official. The mock rounds were held for 65,121 engineering seats. The number of students in the engineering merit list this year is 32,251 of which 30,948 participated in the choice filling exercise for engineering courses. Last year, in the mock round around 32,000 seats had remained vacant, said an ACPC official. After the first two rounds of admissions, as many as 39,000 seats out of 62,000 seats had been vacant, he added. This year, the number of vacant seats could see a steep rise as the total number of engineering seats have increased to 72,388 because of implementation of additional 10 per cent seats for Economically Weaker Section (EWS) quota. After the mock round, the choice filling session for admissions will be held from June 19 to June 23.There are 21 government and grant-in-aid engineering colleges across the state which have 13,478 seats. In these colleges, 11,202 seats were allotted in the mock round and 2,276 seats remained vacant. In the case of 117 private colleges where mock round was held, seats were allotted to 17,587 candidates out of 51,643. The remaining 36,068 seats remained vacant. In the mock round, mechanical engineering saw the highest number of vacant seats (10,148) followed by civil engineering (7,627), electrical engineering (5,388), computer science (3,741), electronics and communication services (2,860), automobile engineering (1,729) and information technology (1,370), among others. \nArjun Kapoor and Kareena Kapoor Khan d.description: College life is certainly the best phase of our lives, be it hanging around with friends, exploring self, trying out new street food, good times never cease to end in college. And these fun moments become more exciting when leading B Town stars pay visit to the campus to promote their movie.  Bollywood celebs Kareena Kapoor Khan and Arjun Kapoor recently visited Silver Oak College of Engineering & Technology to promote their latest movie, 'Ki & Ka'. Needless to say the crowd went berserk to get a glimpse of their desired stars. Divulging more details about the promotional visit, Principal Saurin Shah adds, “Both Kareena Kapoor Khan and Arjun Kapoor were present at the campus for about 4 hours, and about 30 different mediapersons were present at the event who then interacted with the stars. The celebs then visited the college and interacted with the students as well. Both Kareena and Arjun were happy to be with the youngsters and were delighted to see that a crowd of nearly 4000 students was managed so efficiently. The stars then took a selfie with the huge crowd in the background. The warm, happy and interactive session culminated, by the management of Silver Oak College of Engineering & Technology, giving away mementos to both the stars, thanking and appreciating them for their gesture.”  Well, now that’s a college day well spent! Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Jignesh Mevani not invited to SC/ST moni.description: GANDHINAGAR: Jignesh Mevani, scheduled caste activist and independent MLA from Vadnagar, an SC-reserved seat, on Tuesday wrote to chief minister Vijay Rupani and chief secretary J N Singh, about him not being invited to the meeting of the monitoring committee for SC and ST atrocity cases, scheduled for June 19. Jignesh Mevani wrote, “I am surprised as to why as an elected MLA from a scheduled caste reserved seat, I am not being invited to the SC/ST state monitoring cell meeting, where it is mandatory to call SC/ST MLAs/MPs. Earlier, in writing, I had requested you to call this meeting.” Mevani added, “I request you to immediately address the issue of preventive action not being taken by district police and other local authorities. The Act was enacted to take preventive action too, not just to review atrocity cases. There are number of atrocity-prone areas where Dalit are regularly attacked. I request you to immediately take action to notify these areas and take strong preventive action to protect the lives of Dalits. In Rapar taluka of Kutch, the removal of encroachments on Dalit land is ongoing and there is the possibility of a major attack, so I request you to take preventive action.” He further said, “In all atrocity cases, investigation by an SP-rank officer is mandatory, but nobody goes for the investigation.  The DGP for SC/ST atrocity prevention is also not taking sufficient action, so the issue needs to be addressed. The government also needs to announce an action plan for prevention of atrocities on SCs/STs.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Gujarat Contractors\u2019 Association to.description: AHMEDABAD: A two-day Vibrant Summit, machinery exhibition and award ceremony will be organized by Gujarat Contractors’ Association (GCA) on June 22-23 in Ahmedabad. Deputy chief minister of Gujarat, Nitin Patel along with minister of state in the Union government for Shipping (independent charge), chemicals and fertilizers, Mansukh Mandaviya, would be present at the inaugural ceremony of the event which is scheduled to be held at Gujarat University Convention Centre in Ahmedabad. Some 2,000 delegates in addition to more than 5,000 contractors are expected to be part of the event. “Several leaders in the real estate industry including CREDAI India president, Jaxay Shah, along with former GICEA president Bhargav H Desai, among others would also participate in the event,” said Arvind Patel, chairman, GCA. The deputy chief minister of Gujarat, Nitin Patel, will be present at the awards ceremony, wherein awards across some 30 categories would be given away in the construction sector. Half of PGP class at IIM-Ahmedabad has w.description: AHMEDABAD: Out of 388 students of Post-Graduate Program (PGP) batch 2019-21, the flagship programme of IIM Ahmedabad (IIM-A), 49% have work experience of at least 1-3 years, the highest in three years, said IIM-A officials. In 2018-20 and 2017-19, the numbers were 45% and 38% respectively. IIM-A on Friday welcomed the new batches of PGP and PGP-Food and Agri Business Management (FABM) in an event. The batch however slipped in gender ratio. Against 28% and 27% in 2017-19 and 2018-20, this batch comprises 24% female students. Professor Errol D’Souza, director of IIM-A, said that they are conscious about the efficacy of increasing the percentage of women entering their class. “The achievements are slow as the goal is to not give extra credits or specify a quota for gender or other diversity attributes in the admissions process.” The officials insisted on retaining diversity. “Our admissions policy helps us admit students with diverse perspectives to contribute greatly to the discussion-based learning that we employ at IIM-A. This is part of a conscious effort to improve the in-class learning experience of students, who we believe would benefit from being in class with people from diverse backgrounds,” said Prof Vishal Gupta, chairperson (admissions), IIM-A. One of the PGP students is Manasi Susarla, who has a background in journalism and communication. “My key objective behind pursuing this programme is to learn all aspects of managing and strengthening a business while also obtaining necessary industry knowledge and expertise. I believe that a programme in management at this stage will provide me with deeper expertise in other aspects of managing a business,” she said. The PGP-FABM batch has 48% candidates from farming and agricultural background, the highest in three years. Danish S Mehta, one of the students, comes from a farmer family in Haryana. “From the very beginning of my professional endeavours, I had a keen interest in the field of agriculture and wanted to have my own agri-business. My key objective behind pursuing this programme is to learn all the aspects of managing and strengthening a business while also obtaining necessary industry knowledge and expertise,” he said. AJL asked to pay Rs 4.57 lakh to kin of.description: AHMEDABAD: A Motor Accident Claim Tribunal in the city has ordered the Ahmedabad Janmarg Ltd (AJL), which runs BRTS buses, and an insurance agency to pay Rs 4.57 lakh to the family of a 53-year-old woman who was run over by an AMTS bus in BRTS corridor in Maninagar in 2015. A resident of Maninagar, Dipika Patel was run over by a bus run by the AMTS while she was crossing the road at a BRTS zebra crossing near Gopal Tower in Maninagar. The AMTS bus was coming from the BRTS corridor. She died on the spot. The deceased’s husband Bharat and son Vishal sued AJL and the insurance company – the New India Insurance Co Ltd for Rs 7 lakh for accident claim. The AJL as well as the insurer denied the claim in toto. After hearing the case, the tribunal concluded that the evidence suggested that the bus driver was negligent in causing the accident. The tribunal computed the loss of the father-son duo at Rs 4.57 lakh and ordered AJL and the insurer to pay the amount with 9% interest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Businesses on national highways can stay.description: AHMEDABAD: Shops and establishments, situated within municipal corporation areas and on national highways, can now remain open 24x7, according to a new circular issued on Wednesday by the state labour and employment department. Moreover, establishments including eateries, bakeries, grocery stores and medical shops which have less than 10 employees will not require a licence or permission from any district authority or concerned police department to remain open round the clock. However, establishments having more than 10 employees will have to register themselves, though no renewal is required thereafter. The state government, had on Gujarat Foundation Day - May 1 - notified the Gujarat Shops and Establishments (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act 2019, enabling shops and commercial establishments within municipal corporation areas to remain open round the clock. "Earlier shops and establishment on the national and state highways were not included in the notification, but the circular issued on Wednesday included highways too," said Vipul Mitra, additional chief secretary, labour and employment department. Mitra added that shops and establishments in areas under municipal corporations, urban development authorities, national highways, railway platforms, state transport depots, hospitals and petrol pumps can remain open 24 hours without any permission from any authority." Establishments on state highways can remain open till 2am, according to the circular. Establishments within nagarpalika areas can remain open from 6 am to 2 am, but those outside nagarpalika or municipal corporation areas will remain open till 11 pm only. The circular also states that a person cannot be made to work for more than nine hours and women cannot be given shifts after 9 pm. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Yoga improves lipid profile\u2019.description: Ahmedabad: Regular yoga practice is good for your health – and heart, a new study by students of Gujarat University (GU) and Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) claims. The study, published in April edition of Indian Journal of Traditional Knowledge, claimed that the level of lipids — total cholesterol, total triglycerides, LDL-cholesterol and VLDL-cholesterol — went down significantly for those practising yoga regularly. The research was conducted by R J Verma, Devashree Oza, Nikita Vadsaria from School of Sciences, GU and Tapan Patel from CHARUSAT. The team found significant elevation of HDL cholesterol. The study claimed that Dyslipidemia (abnormally elevated cholesterol or fats in blood flow) is direct result of competitive, stressful and sedentary lifestyle and can lead to cardio-vascular diseases, diabetes, obesity and cancer. According to the study, total cholesterol levels after 12 months of hathyogic practices was down at 198.1 mg/dL (milligrams per 0.1 litres) from 240.6, triglycerides at 176.9 mg/dL from 404.7 and LDL to 129.8 mg/dL from 167.9. R J Verma, professor of zoology at GU, said that the primary researcher, Devashree Oza, is a yoga trainer and practitioner at Shivanand Ashram. “The yogic exercises (hathyogic pranayama, yoga postures and meditation) were chosen and administered by her. There were two groups of 50 each — one that practised yoga and one did not. The measurements were taken at 0, 3, 6, 9 and 12 months’ interval to understand the effect. The results showed that yoga surely affects the lipids,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Sparks fly as Ahmed Patel deposes.description: AHMEDABAD: Political sparks flew thick and fast in the courtroom as a senior Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ahmed Patel entered the witness box in the Gujarat high court on Thursday afternoon in connection with a petition challenging his 2017 Rajya Sabha (RS) poll victory. BJP’s Balvantsinh Rajput, who lost the election, has challenged Patel’s victory, claiming that Patel resorted to corrupt practice to influence MLAs to win the election. His advocate Satya Pal Jain, who is the Centre’s additional solicitor general and an active BJP politician, began cross examining Patel by tendering an apology to him in advance that he would be putting across “embarrassing questions”, though he has got high regards for him. Patel expressed his irritation at being called senior leader repeatedly by advocate Jain and put an end to this by asking, “Why do you address me as senior leader all the time? I have come here as Ahmed Mohammed Patel.” Patel did not lose his sense of humour amid the volley of questions. When he was questioned on whether he watches television, he shot back, “Hardly, because there is nothing to watch on television.” When he was questioned during which period he held the post of Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee, Patel looked at senior counsel Nirupam Nanavati, who represents Rajput, and said, “Mr Nanavati knows it very well as he was my general secretary.” It needs mention that Nanavati used to hold top positions in Congress before he deserted the party and started representing BJP men as clients instead. To the question whether he is close to All India Congress Committee (AICC) president, Rahul Gandhi, Patel got irked and questioned the lawyer, “What do you mean by close?” When advocate Jain questioned Patel whether his proposers, nearly 30-40 in different sets of nomination, caused trouble for him, he said, “They may have created problems as some of them left the party.” Immediately, Patel asked the lawyer, “I know why are you asking these questions? The lawyer replied, “I know how to ask. You know how to avoid questions.” Patel had filed his RS nomination on July 26, 2017. A day earlier, a meeting was held at Congress headquarters where the party had issued a whip that all Congress MLAs should vote for Ahmed Patel. On being questioned who all were present in the meeting and where did he sit, Patel replied, “Naturally on the dais.” His irritation was visible and Justice Bela Trivedi also commented on his losing temperament and told advocate Jain, “He felt offended when you put this question.” Patel’s questioning is to continue on Friday. Ahmedabad monsoon action plan washed out.description: AHMEDABAD: Rainfall of 1 inch wrecked the much publicized monsoon action plan of the smart city on Tuesday. Not only were many roads flooded, but cave-ins were also reported from 15 spots in three days. In the end, municipal officials were embarrassed when the mayor on Wednesday gave engineers a dressing down. “What happened to your monsoon plan? It could not withstand even 1 inch of rain,” mayor Bijal Patel told a group of top engineering division staff of the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC). Jivraj park roadPatel’s anger had escalated by the absence of municipal commissioner Vijay Nehra, who had left on an official foreign tour on Monday. “When I asked senior officers why they were not in the field on Wednesday, they had no answer,” Patel told TOI. “I had categorically told them that they should be on the city roads as was the case in 2018.” Ashram roadThe officials were reminded that according to guidelines, work on roads must be stopped before monsoon. Yet work was continuing even after June 15 — the date marking the onset of monsoon. As for the cave-ins, four of the 15 were major. They were reported in Jivrajpark, near Shreenath Heights in Narol, Bhudarpura, and Maninagar. Officials said that contractors are the main culprits. A senior officer said that when it comes to laying drainage or drinking-water pipelines, a tender condition says that once pipelines are laid contractors have to settle the earth. But in most cases, contractors wait for the rain to settle the earth to save costs. The official said that other officials and the elected wing are aware of the practice but ignore it. Ahmedabad International School puts fees.description: AHMEDABAD: The Fee Regulatory Committee, Ahmedabad zone, in an interim order on Thursday said that Ahmedabad International School’s decision to introduce operational services programme has been put on hold. Earlier this month, AIS had sent a circular to parents asking them to pay more money to avail of services and activities that can’t be charged under tuition fees. The programme, meant for Class VIII students, included a charge of Rs 34,825. The FRC, which had received complaints from parents, had called the school authorities to explain their stand on June 19. Senior counsel Sudhir Nanavati, who appeared on behalf of AIS, filed a short notice saying that the circular has been put on hold, according to the interim order passed by FRC chairman Justice K A Puj. The FRC said that till a direction was issued, AIS will maintain the status quo. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians. In Video:No communication on H-1B visa cap from US: Commerce ministryDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Business News.

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nBenchmark Cars host Dream Cars event i.description: Benchmark cars are synonymous with grandiose in the automobile frater. Its association with Mercedes-Benz in 2009 was another feather in its cap, which has now flourished to seven locations covering three statesGujarat, Madhya Pradesh and West Bengal. With robust processes and customer centric approach, Benchmark Cars has won several accolades, including the best in customer satisfaction index, best in service quality and best in service award, thus wearing the badge of the three-pointed star. In keeping with the rich legacy of its glorious past, MercedesBenz plans to augment a gamut of innovative customer oriented initiatives in 2016, which are very much in-sync with the brand's customer centric identity. Keeping up with its 'winning' motto, Mercedes-Benz has launched an exciting range of sedans like GLE 450 AMG Coupe and Edition E.  Recently, Amdavadis were left spellbound when Benchmark Cars organized an event titled 'Dream Cars' at Gulmohar Greens Golf and Country Club, giving performance drive of AMG Cars. The event, which was attended by around 1000 people from different cities of Gujarat, also included Himanshusinh Jadeja, from the erstwhile royal family of Gondal. The event showcased some of the most luxurious and exotic cars from Mercedes-Benz umbrella that left the audience awestruck.  CLA 45 AMG, C 63 AMG, S 63 AMG and E-cabriolet were among the stalwarts to steal the show. The new Mercedes AMG S 63 coupe is the latest dream car to augment the Mercedes-AMG model range and was the showstopper at this event. It is a lethal combination of unparalleled elegance and luxury transformed in a sports car. The drive was given on the most powerful engine of Mercedes-Benz V8. The CLS and S-class, which were kept on display, were a visual delight for the audience. Voted as the world luxury car of the year, the S-class coupe is one of the most beautiful cars in the Mercedes-Benz range. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Decision on using Assam elephants during.description: AHMEDABAD: Amid protests from wildlife activists in Assam, four elephants – aged 10 to 14 years – are slated come to the city from the northeastern state ahead of the Rath Yatra procession. The authorities clarified that there has been no decision taken so far on whether these elephants will be part of the procession itself, due to multiple factors.  In 2018, the Jagannath Temple lost three elephants, bringing down their count to 17. Traditionally, 18 elephants are part of the 1.5km Rath Yatra procession. The procession will be carried out on the traditional route on July 4 this year. Mahendra Jha, trustee of the Shri Jagannathji Mandir Trust, told TOI that the temple had been in talks with the Assam forest department for six months. “The elephants will arrive the by Okha-Guwahati Express. There will be two males and two females. All necessary permissions have been taken for the temporary transfer, as we cannot keep them beyond six months. The train will have mahouts, veterinary doctors and adequate facilities,” he said. He added that elephants are significant to the procession as elephants are considered a form of Lord Ganesha and are considered auspicious. During difficult times, it was elephants who ensured that the chariots were safe, he added. Jha claimed that no decision has been taken on whether the pachyderms will be part of procession. The ritualistic puja of the elephants takes place two days ahead to the procession, after which they are painted for the occasion. Dr R K Sahu, superintendent of Kankaria Zoo, said a lot depends on the temperament of the elephants. “The environmental conditions are different, the place is different and the temperature can certainly play a role. A committee consisting of experts will take a call after a thorough examination of the animals. If distressed, the animals can be a danger at such a public event,” he said. M M Sharma, PCCF, Gujarat, said his Assamese counterpart had consulted him before the decision, to ascertain whether the forest department had any objection. “We laid down stringent conditions ranging from medical facilities during transit, to trained mahouts,” he said. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Ahmedabad: Handy scanners to net e-chall.description: AHMEDABAD: The city traffic police have formed four teams — equipped with hand-held detectors — which will be deployed at random locations to nab serial violators of traffic rules. The detectors will flash the offence history of a vehicle. The team will make the offenders pay the fine on the spot; the failure to pay will lead to the detention of the vehicles. Joint commissioner of police J R Muthaliya said that over the past one-and-a-half months, these teams have collected Rs 2,38,87,000 in fines from about 10,000 commuters. “Most people have started respecting stop lines and zebra crossings,” Muthaliya said. “But some still don’t care about norms and ignore e-challans. The teams will ensure that every commuter who violates norms pays the fine.” City police commissioner A K Singh, who is currently on leave, had told the media at a press conference that traffic police issue about 30,000 e-challans per day and are planning to increase the number to 1 lakh to drill traffic sense into the public. Singh had also said that 38% of violators pay fines voluntarily; 60-62% are wilful defaulters. He had said that defaulters would be made to pay up on the spot. In February, 2.8 lakh signal and stop line violations were recorded; the figure dropped to 2.67 lakh in March; 2.2 lakh in April; and 1.59 lakh in May. Till June 16, traffic police have registered 50,410 signal and stop line violations. “The powerful artificial intelligence in the traffic surveillance system captures images of vehicles while the algorithm detects the violation by calculating the position of the vehicles and the distance from the stop line,” an official said. Muthaliya said that the teams will be deployed in other cities with the government’s approval. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Isanpur: 2 killed in explosion at scrap.description: AHMEDABAD: At around 12.15pm, a loud blast shook the Mauni Hotel lane in Isanpur. Two of the three labourers clearing a space next to the Sahyog Industrial Estate scrap godown were killed in the explosion, with body parts strewn all over the place. A wall nearby also crumbled down. The incident stunned the people in the industrial estate. Eyewitnesses said that the labourers had just begun clearing a room of scrap material, which were largely metal, when the explosion occurred.  Fire officials who reached the spot early claimed that some people nearby had heard the labourers trying to break something. One labourer, Prakash Damor (23), survived the blast. The two others, Kalu Damor (22) and Ashish Pargi, were killed on the spot. Parts of them are buried under the rubble. Two months ago, witnesses had heard a similar blast in the area. Suspecting Thursday’s explosion to have been caused by some explosive material, J division ACP V J Rathod told TOI that a forensics team and the bomb squad had been called to the site. No cranes or buldozers are being used to clear the rubble, instead it is being cleared manually, to preserve forensic evidence. “There are chances that the scrap being dismantled may sometimes included flares or cylinders from the ship breaking yard. But we may be completely wrong,” says a senior fire department official. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nAhmedabad's achievers honoured at a gl.description: CIHF (Confederation of International Healthcare Foundation) and CIAC (Confederation of International Accreditation Commission) in association with KEISIE International University (KIU), South Korea organized the International Education Forum 2016 on April 12 at Hotel Pride Plaza, wherein doctorates (honoris causa), International Women Excellence Award and medals of honour were awarded to distinguished personalities for their contribution towards the society through their dedication and hard work.  CIAC is an international private body ensuring quality assurance, rating and accreditation. KIU is a leading and fast growing research oriented university with a rich heritage in academia and research led innovations.  CIHF, a healthcare non-profit organization was established in 2005 to support and enhance healthcare, education and social well-being. It has been working extensively towards the causes of World Peace through diplomacy and endorses Earth Charter. It is also a participant of United Nations Global Compact for building a just, sustainable, and peaceful global society in the 21st century.  Other medal winners are, Ravish Shah, Gaurav Shah, Hasanali Gulamhusen Patel, Bhargav Valera, Sreedhar Mayavan (Doctorate, Biochemistry) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gujarat HC seeks details on police vacan.description: AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Thursday sought a report from the state government on recruitments to the police department and the number of vacancies in the force. A bench headed by acting Chief Justice A S Dave sought the government’s reply to assess the working conditions of police personnel. This happened after the HC filed a suo motu PIL at the instance of the Supreme Court. Further hearing on this issue is posted on July 4. The HC filed the PIL after the state government filed an affidavit in the apex court in February 2017 and revealed that there were 28,580 vacant posts in the Gujarat police department, out of a sanctioned strength of 1,03,689 posts, thus more than 25% of posts were vacant in January 2017. Acting on these details, the SC in March ordered the high court to take suo motu cognizance of the issue and direct the state to disclose the latest details of vacancies and recruitments. The HC sought various details from the state government including the ratio of police personnel to every 10,000 residents and the distribution of force in large cities, towns, and villages. The HC sought to know remedial measures taken by the state government to protect the fundamental rights of citizens from police action, especially during agitations. The high court also sought details about deployment of police personnel on highways and city streets for effective road traffic management. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ahmedabad civic body discusses waterlogg.description: AHMEDABAD: Waterlogging and delays in pipeline projects dominated the discussions at the AMC standing committee meeting for the second consecutive day on Thursday. Standing committee chairman Amul Bhatt said that officials were again asked by members why works were continuing despite AMC guidelines making it clear that road and other works must be completed before the onset of the monsoon. Bhatt said that they asked the administrative wing to make sure the work ends or is halted as soon as possible. Bhatt said that construction debris was being illegally dumped at corporation plots. At places the debris was overflowing on to the main roads and blocking drainage or storm water lines. “We asked officials to immediately clear such debris from corporation plots,” he said. He also said that he instructed officials to prepare for fogging activities as it is likely that the mosquito menace will increase. The solid waste estate department has been told to clear muck deposited on roads after the rains. The solid waste department was asked told to deploye additional machinery and manpower to clear muck from roads. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Enforce liquor laws strictly, says Pradi.description: GANDHINAGAR: Minister of state for home Pradipsinh Jadeja was learnt to have reproached officials of the home department for lax implementation of laws relating to prohibition, drug use and cow protection. He has directed DGP Shivanand Jha and ACS A M Tiwari to ensure that the concerned departments strictly enforce these laws and submit Action Taken Report (ATR) on a day-to-day basis. The minister is said to have sought an explanation from department officials on the low rate of conviction of bootleggers and why very little action has been initiated against those involved in peddling drugs and narcotics in the state. Officials are said to have informed the minister that there is lack of accountability in some cases as agencies like the Special Operations Group (SOG) report to both the ATS and local police. Key government sources said that Jadeja has received several complaints of availability of liquor and increasing use of narcotics near schools and colleges. “In one instance, the MoS home received a complaint of a liquor den operating in the posh Satellite locality of Ahmedabad, after which he directed the DGP to conduct raids,” the official said. Jadeja convened a separate meeting to evaluate implementation of the newly amended cow protection act. Although stringent provisions have been added to the Gujarat Animal Preservation (Amendment) Act 2017, the on-ground implementation of the act has not been satisfactory enough, officials said. “On the basis of feedback received from animal rights groups, the minister expressed dissatisfaction over enforcement of the act and directed officials to ensure its strict implementation,” said the official. Gujarat woman raped by \u2018naval offic.description: AHMEDABAD: A 26-year-old woman, who is preparing for the UPSC exams, filed a complaint with Vastrapur police alleging that a man, who introduced himself as a naval officer, raped her last November at a hotel in Vastrapur, after promising marriage. The complainant, a native of Chhattisgarh and a resident of Delhi, on Tuesday told police that the accused, Keshav Goyal, aged around 30, befriended her on Facebook last year. “In November 2018, Goyal, who is posted at INS Shivaji in Lonavala, told the woman that he would visit INS Valsura in Jamnagar for ten days and asked her if they could meet at some place in Gujarat. He then told the woman that he had booked a hotel suite in Vastrapur where they could meet,” a police official said. She first met the man on November 7 near Vastrapur lake and after that he asked her to meet him in his hotel room on November 10. “On November 10, when the woman went to the man’s room, he first started talking to her and said that he would marry her. After this he allegedly disrobed and raped her,” said the police official. The woman recently asked the man about their wedding plans but he straight away refused. The woman then came to the city and filed a complaint of rape with Vastrapur police. Vastrapur police started collecting CCTV footage from the hotel and from around Vastrapur lake. Police will also inquiry as to whether the accused is in the Indian Navy or had made a false representation to the woman. The accused has not been nabbed yet. \nBMW India launched the new 7 series in.description: It is a given that many of us have a penchant for luxury cars which exude class, elegance and power. While many of us have a keen eye for fashion that bespeaks nothing less than royalty . And then there are those fabulous evenings when our passion for luxury world class cars and splendid fashion meets. Re and splendid fashion cently Ahmedabad too saw one such glittering evening. BMW India launched the all-new 7 series in Ahmedabad on March 13, at YMCA International Centre. The all ­ new BMW 7 series was unveiled by designer Suneet Varma, Baertels Hans Christian (director -finance, BMW) and Talha Sareshwala (principal dealer, Parsoli Motors). The event saw crème-de-la-crème of Ahmedabad, who were jubilant to not just see the brand new avatar of their favourite luxury car, but were also enchanted when the ace designer, showcased some of his brilliant ensembles. Shambhav Chauhan, Rasesh Desai, Rupesh Shah and some other leading names graced the event.  The BMW group known to bring in innovations blended with the utmost level of luxury, has always curated extravagant car that has molded the future of automotive industry. And this can be seen with the futuristic design and treatment that's been given to the car.  Functions such as BMW ges ture control, BMW laserlight, in addition, with BMW touch command, a tablet for controlling key functions has been integrated into a BMW vehicle for the first time. The group are not just setting new standards but also creating a new future for those who love to flaunt their prized and extravagant possession.
